intro: Claytonia acutifolia var. graminifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forest floors and stream banks. It has a short growing season, blooming in early spring before the leaves wither. Its botanical features make it a unique and valuable component of its native ecosystem.
